column4: hello everyone, I recently upgraded my ram from 512mg to 4 gig running 64 bit kubuntu and now suddently the window composition is slow-- I have an intel coryville motherboard using on board video with a dual core intel Pentium D chip at 2.8 ghz. Any other info that I can give to help, let me know
oh I'm running kubuntu 64 bit 9.04 jaunty
anywhere else I should ask my question to get help?
tried google, but did not find info
so any ideas why my windows composition is slow on an intel built in video card? it was running perfectly with 512 ram and now is too slow with 4 gigs ram. what gives?
are you sure nothing else changed?
absolutely, my bios setting and everything stayed the same. Unexplainable.
kernel update maybe?
I am running 28-15 now, I upgraded the kernel to see if it would help and nothing
I mean that you could try an older kernel...
oh try an older kernel?
actually I added the launchpad repo and then tried doing a dist-upgrade to see if it would help-- nothing
s0crate, "the launchpad repo"?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=865741
it was a suggestion for someone else that was having issues with the windows composition with kubuntu
are you sure that you didn't upgrade the kernel at that same you upgraded your RAM? does removing the newly added RAM help the performance?
I tried putting my old ram in and the compositioning is fine again
duh... interesting :)
it works fine in vista, I'm wondering why. Another thing is I'm running 64 bit linux but it only recognizes 3.2 gigs of ram
I did a memtest on the new ram and it's perfectly fine
I am completely baffled. lol

thanks for the help, I'm going to get back to work, have things to do, but I'll be posting on the ubuntu forums later to see if anyone out there has the slightest clue cause I have no idea why this would happen!
so am I :)
